title: Cannot Reply or Forward from the Message List
content:
When I click on a message from the list of messages in my inbox (Message List, or perhaps also called Thread Pane), I'm unable to select "Reply," "Reply All," or "Forward" without opening that email. I've tried multiple ways, and none of them work: - Keyboard shortcut (Ctrl-R or Ctrl-L) - Menu item 

  -- Message > Reply   -- Message > Forward

- Right click, then select Reply or Forward - Customized menu -- buttons for Reply and Forward

Other keyboard shortcuts/menu items work from the Message List, including compose new message, open, delete, tag, forward as attachment, etc.

When I open the Message Pane (F8), I am able to reply and forward from the Message List using all of the above methods. But I don't want the Message Pane displayed.

When i opened TB in "troubleshooting mode," the problem persisted. I don't have any extensions installed.

I searched and searched and couldn't find anyone else asking this question, so I'm hoping someone here can help.

Thank you!
creator: tdn

title: Transferring email to another account
content: I have set up two e-mail accounts, both GMail. I often need to transfer e-mail from one account to another within the client. Transferring messages from one account to another goes smoothly when they do not have attachments or when the attachment is less than 5MB in size When the message I move contains attachments weighing more than 5MB, Thunderbird crashes and the transfer does not happen. The only solution found, which I would like to avoid, is to download the message with a ‘'save as,’' then drag the .eml file to the right folder in the different account. I have checked and Google does not block the transfer nor are there any problems with quotas (I am a Google Wokspace administrator). Google support confirms to me that there are no blocks and that the operation should go smoothly. They suggest that I contact Thunderbird support. Is there a procedure or setting in the program that allows messages to be transferred smoothly from one account to another even when they contain attachments? Thank you
creator: l.amodei

title: Problema di autenticazione su gmail
content: Buongiorno. Da stamani non riesco ad accedere alla mia gmail installata su thunderbird in quanto mi appare il messaggio "accesso al server imap.googlemail.con con nome utente amministrazione@contemiarifulcis.it non riuscito". Ho provato a reinserire la password ma non la accetta e mi riappare nuovamente il solito messaggio di cui sopra. Non è un problema di gmail in quanto accedendo direttamente alla casella di posta elettronica su gmail è tutto regolare e funzionante. Potete aiutarmi ? Grazie

title: Unable to debug connection problems
content:
I'm having issues with my Thunderbird. Although it has to check for new mail periodically it does not notify me on new email and do not show it in a mailbox until I hit "Get messages" button. And even after that I have to wait for several seconds. There's clearly something wrong but I cannot find what because I cannot find a connection log. Now I have to rely on mail notification daemon to tell me when I must open my Thunderbird and hit the button (to be clear I never exit T, it always runs minimized).

Recently I had a hard time trying to add Zoho account to T. It just didn't work no matter what settings I tried. Eventually I installed Claws Mail and found the root cause in the server response message. Unfortunately this method isn't applicable for the problem I described before - Claws logs can't tell my why Thunderbird doesn't check my mail when it has to.

So, is it possible to add connection log to Thunderbird (I can duplicate this to GitHub issue if necessary)? Or maybe there is one and I just didn't find it somehow (I know about devtool console - it's useless in this case)?
creator: uvizhe
